snippet: Legislation submitted by President Benigno S. Aquino III would create a self-governed, predominantly Muslim region in the country’s south as part of a plan to end decades of conflict with rebels.
abstract: Philippine Pres Benigno S Aquino III submits draft law to congress that would create a self-governed, predominantly Muslim autonomous region in country's south as part of plan to end more than four decades of fighting with rebels; opponents say agreement infringes on Philippine sovereignty, essentially creating a separate Muslim state.
lead_paragraph: Legislation submitted by President Benigno S. Aquino III would create a self-governed, predominantly Muslim region in the country’s south as part of a plan to end decades of conflict with rebels.

headline.main: Philippine Bill Would Give Muslims Autonomy
headline.print_headline: Philippine Bill Would Give Muslims Autonomy
